Julie grew up in Hawaii and uses that for her inspiration, with watermelon, lemon, and coconut water for a bright burst of summer. By BOMBAY SAPPHIRE® GINJune 14, 20214.2(5)Read ReviewsTriangleEmailPinterestPrintTed + Chelsea CavanaughEmailPinterestPrintEmailPinterestPrintIngredients1½oz. Bombay Sapphire3oz. premium tonic water3watermelon balls, for garnish1½oz. coconut water1oz. watermelon juice1lemon wedge, plus 1 lemon wheel for garnishPreparationStep 1Pour the Bombay Sapphire gin, coconut water, and watermelon juice into a balloon glass.Step 2Squeeze the lemon wedge into the glass. Add ice. Pour in tonic. Stir to combine ingredients.Step 3Skewer the watermelon balls onto a cocktail pick. Garnish with watermelon balls and a lemon wheel.
